title: Under Gray Skies

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: Someone's gotta be here. Keep looking.

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: We're wasting our time. There's no one here.

cutscene.speaker: Micaiah
cutscene.line: Hush, Yune! Please, don't cry. If they hear you, you'll give us away.

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: No. It was just a bird.

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: Ha ha ha! Thought we didn't see you?

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: If it's the fortune-teller, we'll be heroes! Without her, the Dawn Brigade is nothing.

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: Oh, the general's going to love this. Bind her.

cutscene.speaker: Begnion Soldier
cutscene.line: Listen up, lass. If you don't want to get hurt, don't struggle.

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: Something must have happened to him.

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: Hey, I have an idea... Micaiah, why don't you use your farsight to see when Leonardo will arrive?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Edward, you know that's not how it works. I foresee some things, but I don't get to choose what I see.

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: I was just teasing! Still, Leonardo's never late. Something must have—-

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: Bandits! Bandits are attacking the town! Run away! Who knows what the brutes will do if they catch you!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Where is the Imperial Occupation Army this time? How can they keep the peace when they're nowhere to be found?

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: Who, the Begnion soldiers?! Hah! They don't care a lick about us! We lost the war, and they won. We're nothing to them.

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: They're only interested in chasing down the Dawn Brigade. They let the real scoundrels run wild and brutalize us.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: They're worse than useless! We'll be glad to help you. Just find someplace to hide, and leave those bandits to us.

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: And don't worry about us. We happen to be members of that same Dawn Brigade that the Begnion troops are so interested in!

intro.speaker: Boy
intro.line: What! Really?! You guys are in the Dawn Brigade?! Wow, my friends and I talk about you all the time!

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: You? But you're just children! Oh, how Daein has fallen... Children, forced to fight and steal for the good of the poor.

intro.speaker: Lady
intro.line: But we can't fight the rogues, so we'll take you up on your offer. Please be careful. They're slice clean through you if they can.

intro.speaker: Pugo
intro.line: Listen up, you louts! This town is nothin' but idiot kids and drooling graybeards. Steal everything you can!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Yune, it's dangerous here. Go find someplace safe for now.

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: Heh heh heh! A pretty little girl like you'll fetch a pretty penny for me! Now be a good girl and come to papa.

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: What did you say? That better not have been an insult, you... Huh!?

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: No matter the manner of man, the goddess judges with an even hand.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Leonardo! How did you find us?

battle.speaker: Leonardo
battle.line: A little bird told me. Yours, in fact.

battle.speaker: Leonardo
battle.line: What were you two thinking, taking on these bandits alone? That's beyond reckless.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: I'm sorry, Leonardo. We couldn't just leave the helpless villagers to these monsters. Please, help us fight them.

boss.speaker: Pugo
boss.line: Who do you brats think you are, the Dawn Brigade?

boss.speaker: Pugo
boss.line: You give proper thieves a bad name. Hah! You like charity? Come closer! I'll show you some charity!

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: These people work hard to feed their families mere scraps. Then you come along and steal what little they've earned.

boss.speaker: Pugo
boss.line: Shut up, kid! I work hard, too! You want honest? Once I've sold you, I'll have earned an honest penny!

end.speaker: Edward
end.line: Fantastic! We won! It's just like you said, Micaiah. They were no match for us!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yune, come here.
You did it!

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: Thank you so much! We owe you our lives.
You there! What are you doing? Stop immediately!

end.speaker: Edward
end.line: Well, well, well. Look who decided to show up... Begnion soldiers. They certainly took their time, didn't they?

end.speaker: Leonardo
end.line: We mustn't be caught. Micaiah! Edward! Make a break for it. Run!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I'm sorry. We have to leave.

end.speaker: Lady
end.line: I know. Thank you again for all you've done. Now, go! Run!

end.speaker: Boy
end.line: Hey, lady! My name's Nico! When I grow up, I want to be just like you guys! Come back sometime!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Hold it! Stop right there!
Who are you bellowing at, soldier?

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: General Jarod?! Wh-when did you arrive?

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Answer my question, maggot. I want to know who you were yelling at and why you did nothing but yell at them.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: S-sorry, sir. We suspect they were from the Dawn Brigade, a band of thieves that targets goods levied from the town. People say they give what they've stolen back to the villagers and strut around acting like heroes.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: They're said to have a witch among them, a girl called the Silver- Haired Maiden. They say she can heal wounds instantly by laying her hands on any injury. Townspeople treat her like a savior.

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: And? What have you been doing about this band of fools?

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Sir. A few days ago we stormed their hideout. We found a girl much like the Silver-Haired Maiden... We ran the dogs from their den, but they were cunning and cautious, and...we lost them.

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: I see. I'm beginning to understand.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: How do you mean, sir?

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: I'm beginning to understand exactly how incompetent you all are!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Urk!

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Make the villagers talk. I want to know who these bandits are and where they're hiding.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Y-yes, sir! Understood, sir!

end.speaker: Alder
end.line: I don't care who they are. The more kick they have in them, the more fun for us, don't you think, sir?

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Precisely. Overseeing this dusty old town is wearing thin. A little fresh game is just what I need.

narration: The northeastern nation of Daein lost a bloody war with neighboring Crimea three years ago. Crimea, however, abdicated its right to rule Daein and passed sovereignty of its former enemy to the powerful Begnion Empire. Daein's future is now subject to the whims of the empire.

Begnion's occupations forces have gathered all of Daein's men of fighting age and put them to work in labor camps. Their work is brutal and void of purpose, designed to break both body and spirit. The remaining population faces poverty and starvation as the fields lie fallow. A band of young heroes has escaped the Begnion army to form a group called the Dawn Brigade. Fighting for a free Daein, they alone have stood against Begnion's forces. They alone have shouldered the hopes of their nation.

Among the company is a young girl named Micaiah, who is said to possess mystical powers. The people of Daein have come to know her as the "Silver- Haired Maiden." They have come to think of her as the savior for whom they had been waiting.

Begnion's forces have tried time and time again to capture and silence the Dawn Brigade. However, Micaiah's ability to sense impending danger has thus far allowed the Dawn Brigade to evade the empire's grasp.
